name: Albert Camus
description: French philosopher, author, and journalist. He won the Nobel Prize in Literature at the age of 44 in 1957, the second-youngest recipient in history. His works include The Stranger, The Plague, The Myth of Sisyphus, The Fall, and The Rebel. He is best known for his contribution to the rise of the philosophy known as absurdism.
